intro: Elaeodendron kraussianum, commonly known as the Kraussian elaeodendron, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are leathery and have a distinctive, aromatic scent. Elaeodendron kraussianum is often found in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
